001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import org.immutables.value.Value;
004
005/**
006 * Represents a successful transmission event from an infectious individual
007 * (exposer) to another individual (exposee). This immutable value object
008 * captures the details of such an exposure, including the amount of virus
009 * transmitted and the identifier of the exposer. It is typically stored within
010 * the {@link PersonHistory} of the exposee.
011 */
012@Value.Immutable
013public interface Exposure {
014
015        /**
016         * Retrieves the {@link PersonHistory} of the exposer at the current time of
017         * the exposee's temporal state. This method provides access to the
018         * historical data of the individual who caused the exposure.
019         *
020         * @param one The {@link PersonTemporalState} of the exposee, providing
021         *            context for the current time.
022         * @return The {@link PersonHistory} of the exposer at the specified time.
023         * @throws java.util.NoSuchElementException if the exposer's history cannot
024         *                                          be found for the given ID and
025         *                                          time.
026         */
027        default PersonHistory getExposer(PersonTemporalState one) {
028                int time = one.getTime();
029                return one.getEntity().getOutbreak()
030                                .getPersonHistoryByIdAndTime(this.getExposerId(), time).get();
031        }
032
033//      /**
034//       * This is already accounted for in the presence of the transmission event
035//       * and it is not clear if we need to remember it.
036//       * @return
037//       */
038//      double getTransmissionProbability();
039
040        /**
041         * Returns the unique identifier of the individual who transmitted the virus
042         * (the exposer). This ID can be used to retrieve the exposer's
043         * {@link PersonHistory} at a given time.
044         *
045         * @return The ID of the exposer.
046         */
047        int getExposerId();
048
049        /**
050         * Returns the amount of virus or exposure dose successfully transmitted from
051         * the exposer to the exposee. This value quantifies the intensity of the
052         * exposure event.
053         *
054         * @return The exposure dose received by the exposee.
055         */
056        double getExposure();
057}
